DataElement.preferredName: Cerebrospinal Fluid Cytology Tumor Cell Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Classification of the results of cerebrospinlal fluid (CSF) cytologic testing for the presence of tumor/malignant cells.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to cerebrospinal fluid cytology being performed._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (seh-REE-broe-SPY-nal) The fluid flowing around the brain and spinal cord. Cerebrospinal fluid is produced in the ventricles in the brain.:Cytology; the branch of biology that studies the structure and function of cells.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.
The light microscopic study of normal and abnormal cells in fine needle aspirates (FNAs), body cavity fluids, and smears.

Property.preferredDefinition: Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Cerebrospinal Fluid Cytology Tumor Cell Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: (seh-REE-broe-SPY-nal) The fluid flowing around the brain and spinal cord. Cerebrospinal fluid is produced in the ventricles in the brain._Cytology; the branch of biology that studies the structure and function of cells._(ma-LIG-nant) Cancerous; a growth with a tendency to invade and destroy nearby tissue and spread to other parts of the body._The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cytology; the branch of biology that studies the structure and function of cells.: Not putting an end to doubt or question; leading to no final results or outcome.

Concepts.definition: The light microscopic study of normal and abnormal cells in fine needle aspirates (FNAs), body cavity fluids, and smears.
Not putting an end to doubt or question; leading to no final results or outcome.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (ma-LIG-nant) Cancerous; a growth with a tendency to invade and destroy nearby tissue and spread to other parts of the body.: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.

Concepts.definition: Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (ma-LIG-nant) Cancerous; a growth with a tendency to invade and destroy nearby tissue and spread to other parts of the body.: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.
